integration.intervalDes: The time interval for collecting monitoring data (unit: seconds).
integration.conditionValidate: Tags, conditions, or values cannot be empty.
integration.meetRule: Meet the following conditions, such as
integration.containerPlaceholder: Please enter the container and press Enter to end
integration.logGroupTips: The effective log grouping scope of this strategy
integration.belongingGroupTips: Receive instance viewing and operations, and isolate permissions according to their organization.
integration.multilineAllRequired: The value must be filled in
integration.multilineDes: Merge the collected logs according to corresponding rules and conditions
integration.timeoutMsTips: Parameter used to control multi-line merge timeout in log processing, in milliseconds (ms). It defines the maximum waiting time for the system to wait for the next matching line. When this time threshold is exceeded, the buffer content will be forcibly flushed for output even if the current log message is incomplete.
integration.modeTips: Defines the aggregation logic for log lines, which determines when the merge will stop based on the rules of start pattern and merge regex.
integration.startPatternTips:
Match the starting line of a new log event using regular expressions to distinguish between independent log entries. 
Typical Application Scenarios: 
1. Java Logs: Starting with a timestamp or log level 
2. Docker Logs: Matching specific prefixes of container logs (such as [2022-10-01]) 
3. SQL Query: Identifying the starting keyword of an SQL statement (such as SELECT)
integration.conditionPatternTips:
Use regular expressions to determine whether subsequent logs should be merged into the current log event. 
Typical application scenarios:
1. Java stack trace: an exception stack using ^s+ matching scaling. 
2. Continuation character scenario: \\$ matches a line ending with a back slash (indicating that the next line is a continuation of the current line). 
3. Terminator scenario: ;$ Match lines ending with semicolons (indicating the end of the log)
integration.continuePast: Stop when encountering lines that don't match the condition, but capture one additional line. For example, when logs end with a backslash \, it will merge both the line with \ and the next line. Suitable for cases where you know you need to read one more line after the end marker.
integration.continueThrough: Continue merging all lines that match the condition until encountering a non-matching line. For example, in Java error stack traces, all lines starting with spaces will be merged into the previous log. Suitable for scenarios with clear 'subordinate line' characteristics.
integration.haltBefore: Keep merging until encountering a line that matches the condition (but not including that line). For example, stop when seeing a new log timestamp, ensuring the timestamp belongs to the next log. Suitable when new logs have clear starting markers.
integration.haltWith: Merge up to and including the first line that matches the condition. For example, when logs end with a semicolon ;, it will include the line with the semicolon to indicate the end. Suitable for cases with clear end markers.
integration.k8sNote: K8S only supports active reporting, and is not supported to be accessed here for the time being.
integration.maxLinesDes: The maximum number of lines that can be combined into one event. If the multiline message contains more than max_lines, any additional lines are discarded.
integration.matchDes: Specifies how Filebeat combines matching lines into an event.
integration.negateDes: Defines whether the pattern is negated.
integration.patternDes: Depending on how you configure other multiline options, lines that match the specified regular expression are considered either continuations of a previous line or the start of a new multiline event. You can set the negate option to negate the pattern.
integration.timeoutDes: After the specified timeout, Filebeat sends the multiline event even if no new pattern is found to start a new event. The default is 5s.
integration.ruleCategoriesDes: Preset rule categories to simplify configuration
integration.containerDes: The container metricset provides container information and status statistics.
integration.eventDes: The event metricset provides Docker event statistics.
integration.healthcheckDes: The healthcheck metricset provides container health check status statistics.
integration.infoDes: The info metricset provides Docker daemon information statistics.
integration.imageDes: The image metricset provides Docker image information statistics.
integration.networkSummaryDes: The network_summary metricset provides network connection summary statistics.
integration.docherNetworkDes: The network metricset provides container network traffic statistics.
integration.cpuDes: The System cpu metricset provides CPU statistics.
integration.loadDes: The System load metricset provides load statistics.
integration.memoryDes: The System memory metricset provides memory statistics.
integration.metricNetworkDes: The System network metricset provides network IO metrics collected from the operating system. One event is created for each network interface.
integration.processDes: The System process metricset provides process statistics. One document is provided for each process.
integration.processSummaryDes: The process_summary metricset collects high level statistics about the running processes.
integration.uptimeDes: The System uptime metricset provides the uptime of the host operating system.
integration.socketSummaryDes: The System socket_summary metricset provides the summary of open network sockets in the host system.It collects a summary of metrics with the count of existing TCP and UDP connections and the count of listening ports.
integration.coreDes: The System core metricset provides usage statistics for each CPU core.
integration.diskIoDes: The System diskio metricset provides disk IO metrics collected from the operating system. One event is created for each disk mounted on the system.
integration.fileSystemDes: The System filesystem metricset provides file system statistics. For each file system, one document is provided.
integration.fsstatDes: The System fsstat metricset provides overall file system statistics.
integration.raidDes: This is the raid metricset of the module system. It collects stats about the raid.
integration.socketDes: The system socket metricset reports an event for each new TCP socket that it sees. It does this by polling the kernel periodically to get a dump of all sockets.
integration.serviceDes: The service metricset reports on the status of systemd services.
integration.auditBeatPathsDes: List of directory paths that need to be monitored
integration.sampleRateDes: It can be adjusted according to network traffic to reduce data volume.
integration.dhcpPortDes: DHCP port configuration, including server ports and client ports.
integration.flowsTimeoutDes: Traffic timeout time (in seconds), connections that exceed this time are considered to have ended.
integration.flowsPeriodDes: Traffic statistics cycle (seconds), outputting statistical information every other time.

packetbeat.protocolTrafficDistributionDesc: Statistics on traffic ratios generated by different protocols (TCP/UDP/ICMP) to help understand network usage. (Unit: GB)
packetbeat.totalNetworkTrafficDesc: Shows network traffic changes over time, helping administrators quickly identify traffic peaks and anomalies. (Unit: GB)
packetbeat.totalPacketCountDesc: Shows total network packets over time, facilitating monitoring of network load and instantaneous peaks.
packetbeat.topSourceIPsDesc: Shows the top 20 source IP addresses with the highest traffic, facilitating discovery of high-traffic sources or potential anomalous sources. (Traffic unit: GB)
packetbeat.topDestinationIPsDesc: Shows the top 20 destination IPs with the highest traffic, used to discover potential traffic hotspots or anomalous targets. (Traffic unit: GB)
packetbeat.highTrafficSankeyDesc: Shows the combination of source IP + destination IP + protocol + source port + destination port with the highest traffic, facilitating locating traffic conditions of specific sessions. (Shows top 20, traffic unit: GB)

event.polymerizationConditionsDes: Please select fields for aggregation, such as selecting the source field for aggregation. The source: 1.1.1.1 and source: 1.1.1.2 in the original log will be calculated separately as two alarm policies, each generating events and alarms
event.queryCriteriaTips: Please fill in the query criteria. Once the query criteria are met, an alarm will be generated
event.keywordAlertDes: Alert based on keywords according to query criteria
event.aggregationAlertDes: Alert based on log aggregation results
event.setFrequency: Please select the detection frequency, which indicates how often to collect monitoring data.
event.setPeriod: Please select the detection period, which is used to measure the duration within which monitoring data is collected.
event.alertNameTitle: Please fill in the corresponding alarm name for the generated alarm, which can reference aggregated fields as variables, such as (source).
event.keyWordAlertNameTitle: Please fill in the corresponding alarm name for the generated alarm.
event.conditionValidate: Functions, fields, conditions, or thresholds cannot be empty
event.closeTitle: Do you want to close this item?
event.closeContent: After closing, the data cannot be recovered.
event.activeAlarmsMapTips: Display a map of the distribution of all active alarms that meet the filtering criteria.
event.historicalAlarmsMapTips: Displays a graph of the distribution of all historical alarms that match the filter for the selected time range.
event.noticeWay: There is currently no notification channel available. You can go to the
event.displayFieldsDes: Please select the display fields in the alarm details table for the alarms generated in the log, in order to obtain more information for alarm analysis.
